lead_paragraph: A new presidential election in Austria could well serve as a referendum on the central tenets, roles and responsibilities of the European Union.

byline.contributor: Alison Smale reported from Berlin, and James Kanter from Bratislava, Slovakia. Steven Erlanger contributed reporting from London.
byline.original: By ALISON SMALE and JAMES KANTER

headline.print_headline: Anti-Immigrant Party Gets a Do-Over in Austria
headline.main: Austria’s Far Right Presents the E.U. With a New Test at the Polls

snippet: A new presidential election in Austria could well serve as a referendum on the central tenets, roles and responsibilities of the European Union....
abstract: Austria's Constitutional Court rejects outcome of presidential election and orders do-over of presidential runoff, giving far-right anti-immigrant candidate Norbert Hofer opportunity to win; is first time rerun of election has been ordered in country since World War II; outcome of new election could end up being referendum on tenets, rights and responsibilities of European Union.
